page.syntax: A Data(ColumnIndex as N | ColumnName as C)
page.description: Get the value of the data column specified.
page.original:
SQL::Row::Data() Syntax Data as A = .Data( ColumnIndex as N | ColumnName as C ) Argument Description Data The returned column data. A SQL::Row object created with a DIM statement. ColumnIndex The index of the column containing the data. ColumnName The name of the column containing the data.
Description The Data() method returns the data in the specified column. Examples dim conn as SQL::Connection dim rs as SQL::ResultSet dim row as SQL::Row dim connString as C dim select_exp as C connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v8\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" select_exp = "select * from customer where bill_state_region = 'ny'" if .not. conn.open(connString)
ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text)
end end if if .not. conn.execute(select_exp)
ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text)
conn.close()
end end if rs = conn.ResultSet rs.NextRow() row = rs.CurrentRow ui_msg_box("Column Data By Name", "" + row.Data("lastname")) ui_msg_box("Column Data By Number", "" + row.Data(2)) conn.close()
See Also SQL::Row Object Limitations
